channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Sled dog racing hits the dirt in the first U.S. Dryland Mushing Championship
item.description: Racers and their dogs from around the world hit Wisconsin's trails for a fast, snowless take on traditional sled dog racing. Katie Thoresen from member station WXPR reports.
item.content:encoded: Racers and their dogs from around the world hit Wisconsin's trails for a fast, snowless take on traditional sled dog racing. Katie Thoresen from member station WXPR reports.
item.dc:creator: Katie Thoresen

item.title: Spooky but not scary: movies to watch when you want chills, not nightmares
item.description: All Things Considered producers Avery Keatley and Marc Rivers talk about movies that capture the eerie spirit of Halloween without the blood, gore, or jump scares.
item.content:encoded: All Things Considered producers Avery Keatley and Marc Rivers talk about movies that capture the eerie spirit of Halloween without the blood, gore, or jump scares.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: A Virginia vineyard finds a creative way to battle the spotted lanternfly invasion
item.description: A vineyard in Virginia has turned pest control into a pastime, arming visitors with electric fly swatters to protect its vines from lanternflies. Randi B. Hagi with member station WMRA reports on its fly swatting competition.
item.content:encoded: A vineyard in Virginia has turned pest control into a pastime, arming visitors with electric fly swatters to protect its vines from lanternflies. Randi B. Hagi with member station WMRA reports on its fly swatting competition.
item.dc:creator: Randi Hagi

item.title: Floppy disks get a second life at Cambridge University Library
item.description: A new program at the University of Cambridge library in the UK is asking people to bring in their floppy disks so that any digital artifacts on them can be extracted. Among rediscovered files are documents once belonging to Stephen Hawking, says technical analyst Leontien Talboom.
item.content:encoded: A new program at the University of Cambridge library in the UK is asking people to bring in their floppy disks so that any digital artifacts on them can be extracted. Among rediscovered files are documents once belonging to Stephen Hawking, says technical analyst Leontien Talboom.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: A grim legacy of war in Gaza as thousands are left to deal with amputations
item.description: Despite the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the two year-long war in Gaza has left a grim legacy – as well as tens of thousands killed, according to Gaza health authorities, about 170,000 have been wounded and many have lost limbs. Jane Arraf profiles a doctor who lost his leg after an aid truck hit him.
item.content:encoded: Despite the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the two year-long war in Gaza has left a grim legacy – as well as tens of thousands killed, according to Gaza health authorities, about 170,000 have been wounded and many have lost limbs. Jane Arraf profiles a doctor who lost his leg after an aid truck hit him.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Police arrest suspects in high-profile Louvre robbery
item.description: French police have arrested suspects in last week's daring Louvre heist, where thieves disguised as maintenance workers stole a collection of imperial-era jewels in under seven minutes.
item.content:encoded: French police have arrested suspects in last week's daring Louvre heist, where thieves disguised as maintenance workers stole a collection of imperial-era jewels in under seven minutes.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: A DNA match finally identified her rapist. Massachusetts law said it was too late
item.description: A Boston woman's rape case fell apart after a DNA match came too late for prosecution, revealing how Massachusetts' 15-year deadline leaves many survivors without justice. WBUR's Willoughby Mariano reports.
item.content:encoded: A Boston woman's rape case fell apart after a DNA match came too late for prosecution, revealing how Massachusetts' 15-year deadline leaves many survivors without justice. WBUR's Willoughby Mariano reports.
item.dc:creator: Willoughby Mariano

item.title: In Malaysia, President Trump claims credit for brokering peace between Thailand and Cambodia
item.description: During his visit to Malaysia, President Trump highlighted a peace deal between Thailand and Cambodia while signaling trade goals and upcoming talks with China and Japan.
item.content:encoded: During his visit to Malaysia, President Trump highlighted a peace deal between Thailand and Cambodia while signaling trade goals and upcoming talks with China and Japan.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Portland Trail Blazers fans react to gambling scandal
item.description: The Portland Trail Blazers head coach was among several NBA figures arrested this week for allegedly participating in illegal gambling schemes.
item.content:encoded: The Portland Trail Blazers head coach was among several NBA figures arrested this week for allegedly participating in illegal gambling schemes.
item.dc:creator: Joni Auden Land

item.title: President Trump cancels his Putin meeting and reignites tensions with new sanctions
item.description: New sanctions on Russian oil giants show President Trump's frustration with President Putin as his peace effort falters.
item.content:encoded: New sanctions on Russian oil giants show President Trump's frustration with President Putin as his peace effort falters.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer
